p: Viral hepatitis is a silent killer, long neglected in sub-Saharan Africa. 4 Most countries in the region lack national hepatitis prevention and treatment programmes. Vaccination against HBV is included in immunisation programmes but coverage is poor. 1 Immunisation at birth, which is now recommended to reduce vertical transmission, has only been adopted in a few countries. 7 Screening is suboptimal and late diagnosis (ie, when symptoms appear) is extremely frequent. 4 Moreover, the availability of effective antiviral treatments for HBV and DAA is very limited in most African health systems.
